data.title: The best movies on HBO right now (November 2022)
data.meta_description: Don't Worry Darling, we've got all of the best movies that you can watch and stream on HBO right now!
data.text:
Although a subscription to HBO Max may be more bang for your buck, HBO remains one of the top premium cable channels. Why? It’s all in the name: Home Box Office. HBO has gone out of its way to land major motion pictures soon after they hit theaters. It also has the advantage of being able to draw directly from the rich film library of Warner Bros. Pictures, as well as a selection of movies from other studios. Plus, the multiple HBO channels curate the movies for you, so you can just turn on the TV and watch something. But with our newly updated list of the best movies on HBO right now, you don’t have to wait to make your plans.

Looking for more to watch on HBO? We’ve got guides to the best movies on HBO Max, the best HBO series, the best shows on HBO Max, and more.

Recently added to HBO

Don't Worry Darling

r 2022

Raging Bull

r 1980

Predator

r 1987

From Dusk Till Dawn

r 1996

Don't Worry Darling (2022)

48%

6.2/10

r

123m

Genre

Thriller, Mystery, Science Fiction

Stars

Florence Pugh, Harry Styles, Chris Pine

Directed by

Olivia Wilde

Watch on HBO

If your first response to Don’t Worry Darling is “what the heck is going on?!”, then you’re in good company. Alice Chambers (Florence Pugh) is wondering the same thing. Alice and her husband, Jack (Henry Styles), are among the residents of Victory, a town that is run like a cult of personality by Frank (Chris Pine). As Frank and the men work on the Victory Project, Alice and the other women are expected to tend to their homes and be grateful housewives. But why don’t the pieces of their lives fit together or make sense? When Alice can no longer ignore these questions, she slowly discovers the alarming truth behind Victory.

Don't Worry Darling | Official Trailer

Raging Bull (1980)

89%

8.2/10

r

129m

Genre

Drama, History

Stars

Robert De Niro, Cathy Moriarty, Joe Pesci

Directed by

Martin Scorsese

Watch on HBO

Raging Bull is widely regarded as one of the finest American movies ever made, and it earned Robert De Niro an Oscar for Best Actor. Director Martin Scorsese thrillingly adapts the real story of Jake LaMotta (De Niro), a boxer who fought some of the all-time greats in his sport, including Joe Lewis (Coley Wallace) and Sugar Ray Robinson (Johnny Barnes). But Jake’s most important battles happen outside of the ring. Jake’s self destructive streak destroys his first marriage and threatens to derail his aspirations of ever becoming a world champion. The ending of the movie is also quite famous, and you may realize that you’ve already seen it parodied without realizing where it came from.

Raging Bull Official Trailer #1 - Robert De Niro Movie (1980) HD

Predator (1987)

47%

7.8/10

r

107m

Genre

Science Fiction, Action, Adventure, Thriller

Stars

Arnold Schwarzenegger, Carl Weathers, Elpidia Carrillo

Directed by

John McTiernan

Watch on HBO

They say that “in space, no one can hear you scream.” But in Predator, you’ll be hearing plenty of screams in the jungle. Arnold Schwarzenegger solidifies his status as an action star as Major Alan “Dutch” Schaefer, the leader of an elite group of soldiers sent by the CIA on a mission in South America. Just as Dutch and the others start questioning the nature of their mission, they find themselves being hunted by a being not of this world. The Predator (Kevin Peter Hall) makes quick work of Dutch’s men, which leads to a one-on-one battle for the ages.

Predator (1987) Trailer #1 | Movieclips Classic Trailers

From Dusk Till Dawn (1996)

48%

7.2/10

r

108m

Genre

Horror, Action, Thriller, Crime

Stars

George Clooney, Quentin Tarantino, Harvey Keitel

Directed by

Robert Rodriguez

Watch on HBO

Quentin Tarantino wrote and co-starred in director Robert Rodriguez’s From Dusk Till Dawn. Fittingly, this movie starts out like a crime story with bank robbers Seth (George Clooney) and Richie Gecko (Tarantino) on the run from the law. To sneak into Mexico, the Geckos take a pastor, Jacob Fuller (Harvey Keitel), and his children, Kate (Juliette Lewis) and Scott (Ernest Liu), as their hostages. But once they arrive at their destination, the Fullers and the Geckos must make a desperate alliance when they come face to face with actual vampires.

From Dusk Till Dawn Official Trailer #1 - (1996) HD

Elvis (2022)

64%

7.6/10

pg-13

159m

Genre

Music, Drama, History

Stars

Austin Butler, Tom Hanks, Richard Roxburgh

Directed by

Baz Luhrmann

Watch on HBO

If you’re looking for a 100% historically accurate biopic, you won’t find that in Elvis. What you will get is a wildly entertaining film with a star-making turn from Austin Butler as the legendary Elvis Presley. Director Baz Luhrmann frames the story around Elvis’ complex relationship with his manager, Colonel Tom Parker (Tom Hanks), the man who helped make Elvis a music icon. You can expect to see this flick get a lot of attention around Oscar time. And now it’s available on both HBO and HBO Max for anyone who missed it earlier this year.

Baz Luhrmann’s ELVIS | Official Trailer

Hot Tub Time Machine (2010)

63%

6.4/10

pg

101m

Genre

Science Fiction, Comedy, Adventure

Stars

John Cusack, Lyndsy Fonseca, Collette Wolfe

Directed by

Steve Pink

Watch on HBO

Hot Tub Time Machine is what we call a “high concept comedy.” The title is the premise. After Lou Dorchen (Rob Corddry) nearly loses his life, his estranged friends, Adam Yates (John Cusack) and Nick Webber-Agnew (Craig Robinson), plan to take Lou on a trip to Colorado to recreate a vacation they enjoyed as kids. While accompanied by Adam’s nephew, Jacob Yates (Clark Duke), the four accidentally dump an energy drink on a hot tub that somehow sends them back in time to their youth. Now inhabiting their younger bodies, Adam, Lou, and Nick try to maintain history as they know it despite the temptation to change their lives.

Hot Tub Time Machine Official Trailer #1 - Craig Robinson Movie (2010) HD

Airplane! (1980)

78%

7.7/10

pg

88m

Genre

Comedy

Stars

Robert Hays, Julie Hagerty, Leslie Nielsen

Directed by

Jerry Zucker, Jim Abrahams, David Zucker

Watch on HBO

If we were to simply tell you the plot of Airplane!, you might confuse it for an actual drama. Instead, it’s one of the silliest movies ever made, and an all-time great comedy that is filled with sight gags and hilarious dialogue. Robert Hays stars as Ted Striker, a former military pilot who is so traumatized by his war experience that he can’t fly any longer. That’s one of the reasons why Elaine Dickinson (Julie Hagerty) left Ted behind. But when the crew of their plane is taken out by food poisoning, an incredulous Ted is called upon to save the day. But first, viewers will meet “Otto,” the plane’s inflatable autopilot who kind of steals the show…and the plane!

Airplane (1980) Movie Trailer

A Private War (2018)

75%

6.7/10

r

106m

Genre

War, Drama

Stars

Rosamund Pike, Jamie Dornan, Tom Hollander

Directed by

Matthew Heineman

Watch on HBO

A Private War is based on the true story of war correspondent Marie Colvin, and it is not for the faint of heart. Rosamund Pike portrays Colvin on-screen as the film follows some of her most memorable journeys into countries that were torn apart by civil war. Colvin pays a very high physical price for her bravery and determination, and she doesn’t back down from danger. There is a very tragic element in her story, but also many reasons to celebrate her life and what she stood for. This film stands as a tribute to that.

A Private War Trailer #1 (2018) | Movieclips Trailers

Under the Skin (2014)

80%

6.3/10

r

108m

Genre

Thriller, Science Fiction, Drama

Stars

Scarlett Johansson, Jeremy McWilliams, Lynsey Taylor Mackay

Directed by

Jonathan Glazer

Watch on HBO

Is it a stretch to cast Scarlett Johansson as a beautiful woman? It is when the woman isn’t of this Earth, as she was in the sci-fi film Under the Skin. Johansson plays an otherwise featureless alien who wears the skin of a deceased woman to lure men to their doom in some kind of portal to another dimension. The alien feels no emotion as she watches her victims die … at least until she faces an unexpected sensation of empathy. She flees as she suffers from a serious identity crisis while pursued by enigmatic members of her own race. However, she can only run so far before she comes face to face with both the best and the worst that humanity has to offer.

Under The Skin | Official Trailer

Ex Machina (2015)

78%

7.7/10

r

108m

Genre

Drama, Science Fiction

Stars

Domhnall Gleeson, Alicia Vikander, Oscar Isaac

Directed by

Alex Garland

Watch on HBO

From one out-of-this-world woman to another! Ex Machina introduces viewers to Ava (Alicia Vikander), the first true AI in the world. She has the body of a robot and the face of an angel. Ava is also disturbingly human-like. That’s why a reclusive CEO, Nathan Bateman (Oscar Isaac), allows a lowly programmer named Caleb Smith (Domhnall Gleeson) to determine just how human Ava really is. It’s an interesting challenge, but Ava is playing her own game. And not even Nathan can predict the actions that she will take.

Ex Machina | Official Trailer HD | A24

Room (2015)

86%

8.1/10

r

118m

Genre

Drama, Thriller

Stars

Brie Larson, Jacob Tremblay, Joan Allen

Directed by

Lenny Abrahamson

Watch on HBO

Brie Larson won an Oscar for her leading role in Room as Joy Newsome, while seven-year-old Jacob Tremblay was also impressive as her onscreen son, Jack Newsome. For seven years, Joy and Jack have been held prisoner by Old Nick (Sean Bridgers), Jack’s biological father and the man who kidnapped Joy. To keep her son’s spirits up, Joy convinces him that only their life in the room is real. But when Old Nick’s abuse becomes too much to bear, mother and son must plan their escape. However, the challenges that they face only get more difficult once they make their bid for freedom.

Room | Official Trailer HD | A24

Invasion of the Body Snatchers (1978)

75%

7.4/10

pg

116m

Genre

Horror, Mystery, Science Fiction

Stars

Donald Sutherland, Brooke Adams, Jeff Goldblum

Directed by

Philip Kaufman

Watch on HBO

The ending of Invasion of the Body Snatchers is so famous and unsettling that you’ve probably already seen it, even if you didn’t realize it at the time. This remake of the ‘50s sci-fi/horror film is truly terrifying as Matthew Bennell (Donald Sutherland) and Elizabeth Driscoll (Brooke Adams) discover that San Francisco is being overrun by aliens who can perfectly duplicate a human body while they sleep. Even though Matthew and Elizabeth go to great lengths to stay awake, not everyone around them is as fortunate as they are. And soon enough, they may be among the last humans living in the city before the invasion expands.

Invasion of the Body Snatchers (1978) - Official Trailer (HD)

Gravity (2013)

96%

7.7/10

pg-13

91m

Genre

Science Fiction, Thriller, Drama

Stars

Sandra Bullock, George Clooney, Ed Harris

Directed by

Alfonso Cuarón

Watch on HBO

Director and co-writer Alfonso Cuarón delivered a visually dazzling masterpiece with Gravity, which stars Sandra Bullock as astronaut Dr. Ryan Stone. When a disaster in space leaves Ryan’s life in jeopardy, Lieutenant Matt Kowalski (George Clooney) takes it upon himself to save her. However, the two astronauts discover that their situation is even more dire than before, and their chances of returning to Earth are slim. Literally all they have left is each other, and soon, they won’t even have that.

Gravity - Official Main Trailer [2K HD]

Last Night in Soho (2021)

65%

7.1/10

r

117m

Genre

Thriller, Horror, Mystery

Stars

Thomasin McKenzie, Anya Taylor-Joy, Matt Smith

Directed by

Edgar Wright

Watch on HBO

Last Night in Soho is the tale of two women: Ellie Turner (Thomasin McKenzie) and Sandie (Anya Taylor-Joy). In the present, Ellie somehow experiences the life of Sandie in the ‘60s as if she is both an observer and Sandie herself. As much as Ellie admires Sandie, she is also horrified when Sandie’s boyfriend, Jack (Matt Smith), destroys her dreams and forces her into prostitution. When Ellie’s visions lead her to believe that Jack murdered Sandie, Ellie becomes determined to bring him to justice. At the same time, Ellie is haunted by visions that threaten to drive her out of her mind.

LAST NIGHT IN SOHO - Official Trailer [HD] - Only in Theaters October 29

Thirteen (2003)

70%

6.8/10

r

100m

Genre

Drama

Stars

Evan Rachel Wood, Nikki Reed, Holly Hunter

Directed by

Catherine Hardwicke

Watch on HBO

If you’re looking for a feel-good coming-of-age film … it definitely isn’t Thirteen. This teenage drama is still shocking nearly two decades after its release. Evan Rachel Wood stars as Tracy Freeland, a 13-year-old girl who ingratiates herself into the life of her popular classmate, Evie Zamora (Nikki Reed). Evie proves to be a very bad influence on Tracy, and vice versa. They enable each other, which only leads to conflict when they inevitably fall out. Tracy will also come to realize that her actions have come with a very high cost.

Thirteen (2003) Official Trailer #1 - Evan Rachel Wood Movie HD

Lone Survivor (2013)

60%

7.5/10

r

121m

Genre

War, Action, Drama, History

Stars

Mark Wahlberg, Taylor Kitsch, Emile Hirsch

Directed by

Peter Berg

Watch on HBO

Lone Survivor is based on a real story from the long war in Afghanistan. Mark Wahlberg stars as Hospital corpsman First Class Marcus Luttrell, a member of a small team including Lieutenant Michael P. “Murph” Murphy (Taylor Kitsch) and Gunner’s mate Second Class Danny Dietz (Emile Hirsch). The men are on a mission to find a Taliban commander, but they soon find themselves in way over their heads as the Taliban soldiers overwhelm them. As the title implies, only one member of this team is going to make it out alive. But not without a lot of spilled blood on both sides of the battle.

Lone Survivor Official Trailer #1 (2013) - Mark Wahlberg Movie HD

Total Recall (1990)

57%

7.5/10

r

113m

Genre

Action, Adventure, Science Fiction

Stars

Arnold Schwarzenegger, Rachel Ticotin, Sharon Stone

Directed by

Paul Verhoeven

Watch on HBO

There are two versions of Total Recall that made it into theaters, but the original is still the one you should watch. Arnold Schwarzenegger steps away from his Terminator sense of invulnerability as a seemingly ordinary construction worker named Douglas Quaid. When Quaid decides to have memories of a Martian vacation put into his head, he comes to believe that he was a secret agent even before any fake memories were implanted. Soon, nearly everyone Quaid knows is trying to kill him, including his wife, Lori (Sharon Stone). The answers to Quaid’s questions lie on Mars, if he can survive long enough to get there.

TOTAL RECALL (1990) | 4K Restoration | Official Trailer | Dir. by Paul Verhoeven

Highlander (1986)

24%

7.1/10

r

116m

Genre

Adventure, Action, Fantasy

Stars

Christopher Lambert, Roxanne Hart, Clancy Brown

Directed by

Russell Mulcahy

Watch on HBO

It doesn’t get more ‘80s than the original Highlander movie. With its rockin’ soundtrack by Queens and endearing performances by Christopher Lambert and Sean Connery, this cult classic cable staple is back where it belongs on HBO. Within the film, Lambert stars as Connor MacLeod, an immortal who is mentored by a warrior named Juan Sánchez-Villalobos Ramírez (Connery). Through his friendship with Ramirez, Connor learns that every immortal is in a centuries-long race to claim “the prize.” There can only be one in the end. And in present day New York, Connor must confront his eternal rival, The Kurgan (Clancy Brown), one last time.

Highlander | 30th Anniversary | Official Trailer

Red Eye (2005)

71%

6.5/10

pg-13

85m

Genre

Horror, Thriller

Stars

Rachel McAdams, Cillian Murphy, Brian Cox

Directed by

Wes Craven

Watch on HBO

The late Wes Craven embraced a different brand of horror in his 2005 thriller, Red Eye. Rachel McAdams stars as Lisa Reisert, a young woman whose innocent flirtations with her seatmate, Jackson Rippner (Cillian Murphy), take a sinister turn. Jackson reveals that he has been sent to blackmail Lisa to make her an accomplice to a political assassination. And if Lisa doesn’t comply, her father, Joe Reisert (Brian Cox), will be murdered before her plane can even land. Somehow, Lisa has to find a way to escape her captor and warn his target without jeopardizing her father’s life or her own.

They Shall Not Grow Old (2018)

91%

8.2/10

r

99m

Genre

Documentary, History, War

Stars

Thomas Adlam, William Argent, John Ashby

Directed by

Peter Jackson

Watch on HBO

World War II has so completely dominated the cultural zeitgeist that the horrors of World War I are largely forgotten over a century after it took place. The Lord of the Rings director, Peter Jackson, aimed to change that with They Shall Not Grow Old, a 2018 documentary that restores footage of the First World War with vivid details. There is some embellishment with voice actors and sound effects, but those are complementary elements for one of the most engrossing depictions of war seen on screen in a long time.

They Shall Not Grow Old – New Trailer – Now Playing In Theaters

The Batman (2022)

72%

7.9/10

pg-13

176m

Genre

Crime, Mystery, Thriller

Stars

Robert Pattinson, Zoë Kravitz, Paul Dano

Directed by

Matt Reeves

Watch on HBO

Robert Pattinson had a lot to prove in The Batman, and fans were certainly skeptical about whether he could follow Ben Affleck in the title role. But Pattinson came through in director Matt Reeves’ reinvention of Gotham City and its Dark Knight. In this story from early in his career as the Caped Crusader, Batman is forced to contend with Riddler (Paul Dano), a deranged genius who is out to expose Gotham’s corruption while arranging for its destruction. If this Batman is going to overcome the odds, then he will have to be both a detective and a hero.

THE BATMAN – Main Trailer

The Survivor (2022)

71%

6.8/10

r

129m

Genre

Drama, History

Stars

Ben Foster, Vicky Krieps, Billy Magnussen

Directed by

Barry Levinson

Watch on HBO Max

Boxing movies are usually inspirational stories about an underdog rising to the top against all odds. But in The Survivor, Harry Haft (Ben Foster) had his biggest matches in the Holocaust. Harry’s true story is explored in harrowing black-and-white flashback sequences as he is forced to box for his life in concentration camps. Harry is also well aware that the loser of the bout will be shot. Years later, Harry’s professional boxing career begins to take shape in the United States. But the one thing Harry really wants is to find the woman he loved, Miriam Wofsoniker (Vicky Krieps) — if she survived the Holocaust as well.

The Survivor | Official Trailer | HBO

Terminator 2: Judgment Day (1991)

75%

8.6/10

r

137m

Genre

Action, Thriller, Science Fiction

Stars

Arnold Schwarzenegger, Linda Hamilton, Edward Furlong

Directed by

James Cameron

Watch on HBO

In the last 30 years, there have been four additional Terminator sequels. But no one has made a better sequel than James Cameron’s Terminator 2: Judgment Day. This flick has such superior filmmaking that it still surpasses many modern blockbusters. Arnold Schwarzenegger and Linda Hamilton reprise their respective roles as a T-800 Terminator and Sarah Connor. Newcomer Edward Furlong played Sarah’s son, John Connor, the future savior of humanity. Much to Sarah’s surprise, she and the T-800 share a common goal of protecting John from the advanced T-1000 model, as portrayed by Robert Patrick.

Terminator 2: Judgment Day (1991) Trailer #1 | Movieclips Classic Trailers

Sliding Doors (1998)

59%

6.7/10

pg-13

99m

Genre

Comedy, Drama, Fantasy, Romance

Stars

Gwyneth Paltrow, John Hannah, John Lynch

Directed by

Peter Howitt

Watch on HBO

Multiverses are all the rage in superhero movies, but Gwyneth Paltrow was hanging out in parallel realities long before she co-starred in Iron Man. In Sliding Doors, Paltrow plays Helen Quilley, a young woman whose life spins in different directions depending upon whether she caught her train on time. If she does catch it, Helen dumps her cheating ex, Gerry (John Lynch), and finds new love with James Hammerton (John Hannah). And if she doesn’t catch the train, Helen stays with Gerry, unaware that he’s also seeing a woman named Lydia (Jeanne Tripplehorn). There is sorrow and joy in both incarnations of Helen’s life, but not every ending can be happy.

Sliding Doors (1998) - Official Trailer

King Richard (2021)

76%

7.5/10

pg-13

145m

Genre

Drama, History

Stars

Will Smith, Aunjanue Ellis, Saniyya Sidney

Directed by

Reinaldo Marcus Green

Watch on HBO

Will Smith won an Oscar for Best Actor for his performance as Richard Williams in the biopic King Richard. Smith also lost his temper at the Oscars and overshadowed what should have been his crowning achievement. Regardless of the current controversy surrounding Smith, King Richard is truly one of the best films of 2021. It also happens to be based on the true story of Richard, the father of tennis legends Venus (Saniyya Sidney) and Serena Williams (Demi Singleton). It’s simply a well-crafted drama that shouldn’t be swallowed whole by something that had nothing to do with the film itself.

KING RICHARD – Official Trailer

Only Lovers Left Alive (2013)

79%

7.2/10

r

123m

Genre

Drama, Romance

Stars

Tom Hiddleston, Tilda Swinton, Mia Wasikowska

Directed by

Jim Jarmusch

Watch on HBO

Adam (Tom Hiddleston) wants to die in Only Lovers Left Alive. Naturally, Adam’s increasingly suicidal behavior alarms his wife, Eve (Tilda Swinton). From her perspective, Adam already has a lot to live for … especially since he already died once when he became a vampire. Eve is also a vampire, and she desperately tries to get Adam to remember how good their lives together can be. Unfortunately, Eve’s younger sister, Ava (Mia Wasikowska), rolls into town like a hurricane and threatens to undo Eve’s attempt to bring Adam back from the edge of despair.

Only Lovers Left Alive | Official Trailer HD (2013)

Man of Steel (2013)

55%

7.1/10

pg-13

143m

Genre

Action, Adventure, Fantasy, Science Fiction

Stars

Henry Cavill, Amy Adams, Michael Shannon

Directed by

Zack Snyder

Watch on HBO

It’s hard to believe that it’s been almost 10 years since we’ve had a truly solo Superman movie. Man of Steel kicked off the DC Extended Universe with Clark Kent (Henry Cavill) trying to find his way in the world long before he even thinks about becoming Superman. Amy Adams plays a thoroughly modern Lois Lane who figures out Clark’s secret right away. But before Clark and Lois can define their relationship, renegade Kryptonians led by General Zod (Michael Shannon) come to Earth to neutralize Superman and transform the planet into their new home.

Man of Steel - Official Trailer 3 [HD]

The Incredible Hulk (2008)

61%

6.6/10

pg-13

114m

Genre

Science Fiction, Action, Adventure

Stars

Edward Norton, Liv Tyler, Tim Roth

Directed by

Louis Leterrier

Watch on HBO

Now here’s something you don’t see everyday. Incredible Hulk is a Marvel Studios movie on HBO because the film was distributed by Universal Pictures, one of the few studios not owned by Disney. And yet it’s still MCU canon despite Edward Norton’s one and only appearance as Bruce Banner/Hulk. After hiding out in South America, Bruce returns to the United States and reunites with his ex-girlfriend, Betty Ross (Liv Tyler). All Bruce wants is a cure for his condition, but Betty’s father, General Thaddeus “Thunderbolt” Ross (William Hurt), basically wants to dissect Bruce’s body so he can create a new generation of super soldiers. And the prospect of gaining superhuman strength is a little bit too appealing to the General’s top operative, Emil Blonsky (Tim Roth).

The Incredible Hulk (2008) Official Trailer - Edward Norton, Liv Tyler Movie HD

A Shot in the Dark (1964)

70%

7.4/10

pg

102m

Genre

Comedy, Crime, Mystery

Stars

Peter Sellers, Elke Sommer, George Sanders

Directed by

Blake Edwards

Watch on HBO

A Shot in the Dark is the second film in the Pink Panther series, but don’t worry. All you really need to know going in is that Inspector Jacques Clouseau (Peter Sellers) is one of the most comically inept detectives of all time and that the opening animated sequence (complete with the actual Pink Panther) is absolutely hilarious. In this film, there’s been a murder at the home of millionaire Benjamin Ballon (George Sanders). All of the evidence points to a maid, Maria Gambrelli (Elke Sommer). However, Jacques is so smitten with Maria that he keeps getting her off the hook, even as the bodies start to pile up.

A Shot in the Dark Official Trailer #1 (1964) - Peter Sellers Movie HD

Darkest Hour (2017)

75%

7.4/10

pg-13

125m

Genre

Drama, History

Stars

Gary Oldman, Kristin Scott Thomas, Lily James

Directed by

Joe Wright

Watch on HBO

Gary Oldman gives a powerhouse performance as Winston Churchill in Darkest Hour, a dramatization of Britain’s early days in World War II after most of Europe fell to Germany. Churchill correctly predicted the threat of the Nazis, but he doesn’t always know how to handle them. As Neville Chamberlain (Ronald Pickup) and Viscount Halifax (Stephen Dillane) pressure Churchill to make peace with Germany, the prime minister has to find a way to rally a nation for war before the Nazi onslaught becomes unstoppable.

Darkest Hour Trailer #1 (2017) | Movieclips Trailers

Capturing the Friedmans (2003)

90%

7.7/10

107m

Genre

Documentary

Stars

Arnold Friedman, Elaine Friedman, Jesse Friedman

Directed by

Andrew Jarecki

Watch on HBO

Andrew Jarecki’s HBO original documentary Capturing the Friedmans is nearly two decades old. However, it has lost none of its power. In the mid-80s, Arnold Friedman and his son, Jesse, were accused of sexually abusing students in Arnold’s computer tutoring sessions. This documentary incorporates home movies filmed by Jesse’s brother, David, which show the mundane moments with the family as well as heated arguments between Arnold and his wife, Elaine, about his possible guilt and whether he should take a deal to spare his son a prison sentence. There are no easy answers here, as the Friedman family gives contradictory info to outsiders and to themselves.

Capturing the Friedmans (2003) Official Trailer #1 - Shocking Documentary Movie HD

Introducing Dorothy Dandridge (1999)

7.1/10

r

115m

Genre

Drama

Stars

Halle Berry, Brent Spiner, Klaus Maria Brandauer

Directed by

Martha Coolidge

Watch on HBO

Do you know who Dorothy Dandridge was? She was the first African American actress to be nominated for Best Actress in the Oscars, and a true superstar at a time when racism was rampant in both Hollywood and America. In the HBO original movie Introducing Dorthy Dandridge, Halle Berry seamlessly steps into the role of a screen icon in this unflinching look at her life and struggles. Because as successful as Dandridge was for the time, she should have been an even bigger star given her talent, her beauty, and her untimely demise at only 42 years old. This film helps keep Dandridge’s legacy alive, and it’s one of Berry’s best performances.

Dirty Rotten Scoundrels (1988)

68%

7.4/10

pg

110m

Genre

Crime, Comedy

Stars

Steve Martin, Michael Caine, Glenne Headly

Directed by

Frank Oz

Watch on HBO

It’s almost impossible for a film to miss the mark when Michael Caine and Steve Martin are in the leading roles. And Dirty Rotten Scoundrels utilizes its leading men to great comedic effect by making them rival con artists: Freddy Benson (Martin) and Lawrence Jamieson (Michael Caine). Although Lawrence is somewhat disgusted by Freddy’s over-the-top cons, he briefly takes him on as a partner. When their partnership comes to a bitter end, they make a bet to determine who will leave town. Toward that end, they both target Janet Colgate (Glenne Headly) and try to be the first to con her out of $50,000. However, Janet has secrets of her own …

Dirty Rotten Scoundrels (1988) - Official Trailer (HD)

Orange County (2002)

48%

6.2/10

pg-13

82m

Genre

Comedy, Drama

Stars

Colin Hanks, Jack Black, Schuyler Fisk

Directed by

Jake Kasdan

Watch on HBO

Believe it or not, 2022 is the 20th anniversary of Orange County, the offbeat comedy starring Colin Hanks and Jack Black. Chasing Amy remains director Kevin Smith’s best film to date, thanks to its frank depiction of sex, romance, and the ensuing emotional blowback. Ben Affleck stars as comic book illustrator Holden McNeil, a young man who becomes instantly infatuated with Alyssa Jones (Joey Lauren Adams). Despite his initial surprise that Alyssa is a lesbian, Holden’s feelings for her continue unabated. When Alyssa begins to reciprocate those feelings, Holden’s friend and partner, Banky Edwards (Jason Lee), is openly threatened by their burgeoning romance. Regardless, Holden proves to be his own worst enemy when his insecurity threatens his emotional bonds to both Alyssa and Banky.

The English Patient made audiences swoon in 1996, thanks to its epic romance set against the backdrop of World War II. Ralph Fiennes stars as Almásy, a badly-burned man facing the end of his life in the war’s final days. While a nurse named Hana (Juliette Binoche) cares for him, Almásy puts together the pieces of his past. That includes Almásy’s torrid affair with Katharine Clifton (Kristin Scott Thomas), a married woman. Hana has a tentative romance of her own with Kip (Naveen Andrews), a soldier in the British army. Willem Dafoe also stars in the movie as a Canadian intelligence officer named Caravaggio, a man who holds a dangerous grudge against Almásy.

Spike Lee cast NBA superstar Ray Allen in his film He Got Game. That gave a lot of credibility to Allen’s role as Jesus Shuttlesworth, the top basketball prospect in the nation. Jesus is so highly coveted that the governor temporarily paroles his father, Jacob “Jake” Shuttlesworth (Denzel Washington). If Jake can get his son to commit to the governor’s alma mater, then he can go free. However, the lingering hostility between Jesus and Jake means that the son isn’t exactly eager to do his father any favors. Not even a one-on-one basketball game can settle their issues. Instead, the father and son will have to look within for resolution and reconciliation.

For his third feature film, Insomnia, Christopher Nolan turned to a stellar cast for this psychological thriller. Al Pacino stars as Will Dormer, a police detective plagued by guilt and insomnia while on a special case in Alaska. After Will’s partner, Detective Hap Eckhart (Martin Donovan), threatens to testify against him to Internal Affairs, Will shoots Hap while in pursuit of a killer, Walter Finch (Robin Williams). Walter takes the opportunity to blackmail Will into helping him escape the charges, while a young detective, Ellie Burr (Hilary Swank), gets closer to the truth.

Young Pi is trapped on a lifeboat with an intimidating Bengal tiger named Richard Parker. While Richard Parker could easily kill Pi, the teenager finds a way for both of them to co-exist as they fight the elements for their lives.

Christopher Nolan’s Dunkirk is based on a true World War II story. In the aftermath of the Battle of France, thousands of British soldiers were stranded on Dunkirk as German troops advanced. The film follows the rescue effort by sea and by air. But back in Dunkirk itself, soldiers Tommy (Fionn Whitehead) and Alex (Harry Styles) find danger at every turn. The first few rescue attempts are disastrous, and even the rescuers are in danger. Not everyone is going to come home from this mission.

Independence Day is not necessarily great cinema, but it excels as a popcorn action flick that took theaters by storm in 1996. Arguably, it was the film that made Will Smith a movie star, thanks to his turn as ace fighter pilot Captain Steven Hiller. But the real stars of this movie are the aliens themselves and the destruction that they leave in their wake. This is a disaster film dialed up to 11, and we still get goosebumps from President Thomas J. Whitmore (Bill Pullman) as he delivers a speech for the ages.

Stars

Watch on HBO

After the success of 7 Days in Hell, a mockumentary about a legendary tennis match between two fictional idiots, the Andy Samberg-led team earned a second go-round via HBO. The result? Tour de Pharmacy, a story that spoofs the Tour de France by focusing on competitors’ use of performance-enhancing substances in the early 1980s. Samberg returns to play Nigerian rider Marty Hass, while Orlando Bloom, Freddie Highmore, Daveed Diggs, and John Cena appear as the other made-up competitors. Tour de Pharmacy is filled with classic slapstick comedy, and the concept is bolstered by the inclusion of several veteran actors — we won’t spoil the hilarious surprises here — who play the “modern-day” versions of the film’s protagonists. Lance Armstrong’s cameo doesn’t hurt, either.

Clerks (1994)

70%

7.7/10

r

92m

Genre

Comedy

Stars

Brian O'Halloran, Jeff Anderson, Jason Mewes

Directed by

Kevin Smith

Watch on HBO

Clerks was the film that famously launched the career of writer and director Kevin Smith, who also co-stars in the movie as Silent Bob alongside Jason Mewes’ Jay. While Jay and Silent Bob became staples of Smith’s later films, Clerks belongs to Brian O’Halloran’s Dante Hicks and Jeff Anderson’s Randal Graves. Dante and Randal’s banter showed off Smith’s gift for dialogue, but it also allowed them to be more than just Smith’s pop culture sounding board. The duo justifiably have contempt for their dead-end jobs, but they don’t necessarily appreciate the good things they do have. It’s a hard lesson for Dante to learn, but he does get the point in the end.

60%

6.1/10

r

109m

Genre

Action, Crime

Stars

Margot Robbie, Ewan McGregor, Rosie Perez, Mary Elizabeth Winstead

Directed by

Cathy Yan

Watch on HBO

Introduced to the role in 2016’s critical bomb, but commercial home run, Suicide Squad, Margot Robbie gets another turn as fan-favorite Harley Quinn in Birds of Prey. Told from Harley’s smart but certifiable point of view, Birds of Prey shows us how Harley goes from being the spurned lover of Gotham’s Clown Prince of Crime, to forgetting her “puddin'” and becoming her own gun-toting, butt-kicking self. Along the way, she gathers a team of former cops, killers, and super-powered singers to help her face down the endless criminal hordes of Roman Sionis (Ewan McGregor), aka Black Mask. McGregor is perfect as the brutal Sionis, who’s just as twisted as Harley or her ex-boyfriend, and Mary Elizabeth Winstead is another standout as the lethal vigilante Huntress.
